Indicator Name: Female share of employment in senior and middle management (%)
Long definition: The proportion of females in total employment in senior and middle management. It corresponds to major group 1 in both ISCO-08 and ISCO-88 minus category 14 in ISCO-08 (hospitality, retail and other services managers) and minus category 13 in ISCO-88 (general managers), since these comprise mainly managers of small enterprises.
Source: International Labour Organization. “Labour Market-related SDG Indicators database (ILOSDG)” ILOSTAT. Accessed January 07, 2025. https://ilostat.ilo.org/data/.
Development relevance: The indicator provides information on the proportion of women who are employed in decision-making and management roles in government, large enterprises and institutions.
